{{Infobox Government agency |agency_name = Main office for SS Personnel |nativename = SS Personalhauptamt |nativename_a = |nativename_r = |logo =Flag Schutzstaffel.svg |logo_width = 100px |logo_caption = The ''Personalhauptamt'' was a main office of the [[SS]]. |seal = |seal_width = |seal_caption = |picture = |picture_width = 300px |picture_caption = [[Reichsführer-SS]] [[Heinrich Himmler]] |formed = c.1939 |preceding1 = |preceding2 = |dissolved = May 8, 1945 |superseding = |jurisdiction = {{flagicon|Germany|Nazi}} [[Nazi Germany|Germany]]
[[Occupied Europe]] |headquarters = SS Personalhauptamt, [[Wilmersdorfer Straße (Berlin U-Bahn)|Wilmersdorfer Straße]], [[Charlottenburg]], [[Berlin]] |latd=52 |latm=30 |lats=28.16 |latNS=N |longd=13 |longm=18 |longs=22.44 |longEW= E |region_code = |employees = 150 |budget = |minister1_name = [[Reichsführer-SS]] [[Heinrich Himmler]] |minister1_pfo = (1939–1945) |minister2_name = |minister2_pfo = |chief1_name = SS-[[Gruppenführer]] Walter Schmitt |chief1_position = Chef fur Personalhauptamt, (1939–1942) |chief2_name = SS-[[Obergruppenführer]] [[Maximilian von Herff]] |chief2_position = Chef fur Personalhauptamt, (1942–1945) |chief3_name = |chief3_position = |chief4_name = |chief4_position = |agency_type = |parent_agency = [[Image:Flag Schutzstaffel.svg|23px]] ''[[Allgemeine-SS]]'' |child1_agency = |child2_agency = |keydocument1= |website = |footnotes = }} The '''SS Personnel Main Office''' ('''{{lang-de|SS Personalhauptamt}}''') was the central recording office for all officers and potential officers for the [[SS]] in [[Nazi Germany]].{{cite web|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=b3W1tiuHzcoC&pg=PA185&lpg=PA185&dq=Personalhauptamt+headquarters&source=bl&ots=r5ZZIwG5nv&sig=j1egbUarDrqW4tcUghbVyx5GDfA&hl=en&ei=s_xESqr-Fp65jAfXktBi&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=2|title=Handbook on German military forces|author= United States. War Dept/Stephen E. Ambrose|date=2006-06-26}} ==Formation== The Personalhauptamt was responsible maintaining the service records for all commissioned ''[[Waffen-SS]]'' and ''[[Allgemeine-SS]]'' personnel. However it did not keep extensive details of non-commissioned or rank and file [[SS]] members. Likewise it was not responsible for promotions or appointments. Its headquarters were originally located on Wilmersdorfer Straße, [[Berlin]] but by1943 the Allied bombing campaign against the German capital had forced the various departments of the Personalhauptamt to relocate throughout [[Nazi Germany]]. ==Organization== The SS-Personalhauptamt consisted of two main departments ({{lang-de|Ämter or Amtsgruppen}}). They were: *'''''Amt für Führerpersonalien''''' ({{lang-en|Office of Officer Personnel Records}}) *'''''Amt für Führernachwuchs''''' ({{lang-en|Office for Potential Officers}}) Within the Office of Officer Personnel Records there were three sub departments. They were: *'''''Amtsgruppe A''''' **'''''Amt I Zentralkartei''''' ({{lang-en|Central Records}}) **'''''Amt II Führernachwuchs und Schulen''''' ({{lang-en|Awards and Schooling}}) **'''''Amt III Disziplinar- und Ehrenangelegenheiten''''' ({{lang-en|Discipline and honours}}) *'''''Amtsgruppe B (Personalamt Allgemeine SS)''''' ({{lang-en|[[Allgemeine SS]] Personnel Office}}) *'''''Amtsgruppe C (Personalamt Waffen-SS)''''' ({{lang-en|[[Waffen-SS]] Personnel Office}}) ==Legacy== The [[Berlin]] headquarters of the ''Personalhauptamt'' was [[Strategic bombing during World War II|bombed]] several times during [[World War II]], but most of the SS records survived the collapse of [[Nazi Germany]]. As such, the files of SS personnel have become an invaluable resource for present-day historians studying the [[Third Reich]]. The archive has allowed researchers to carry out detailed examinations into the roles that major Nazis played in the [[Second World War]] and [[The Holocaust]]. For example, the [[Service record of Reinhard Heydrich|service records]] of SS-''[[Obergruppenführer]]'' [[Reinhard Heydrich]] show how he organised the [[Wannsee Conference]], masterminded the [[Final Solution]] and managed the ''[[Einsatzgruppen]]''. ==References== {{reflist}} {{SS organizations}} {{DEFAULTSORT:SS Personnel Main Office}} [[Category:Nazi SS]] [[Category:SS service records| ]]
